Title: Ministry of Finance wants 50% tax on e-cigarette atomizer
Description:
Forestry exports up 47% in two months
Vietnam's forestry exports totaled US$2.68 billion in the first two months of 2024, up 47.4% year-on-year, according to the Department of Forestry under the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development.
The Ministry of Finance has maintained its proposal to impose a 50% Most-Favored Nation (MFN) tariff on electronic atomizer, the device used to heat up liquid solution used for vaping.

Title: PM urges New Zealand firms to boost investment in Vietnam
Description: Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh urged New Zealand companies to enhance their investment in Vietnam, focusing on innovation, education, and energy sectors.

Title: Vietnam goes past Chile to become second biggest fruit, vegetable exporter to China
Description: Vietnam surpassed Chile to become the second largest fruit and vegetable exporter to China in 2023, thanks to a jump in durian exports.

Title: Chỉ còn 200 suất sở hữu vật phẩm giải chạy Việt Nam Hùng Cường
Description: Quảng cáo

Title: Vietnamese tech talents find homeland has appealing career prospects
Description: Vietnamese tech workers studying and working abroad are returning home in increasing numbers since they find the country offers more opportunities for career advancement than competitive developed markets.

Title: $1.14B worth of government bonds raised in February
Description: The Hanoi Stock Exchange (HNX) held 12 auctions of government bonds with a total volume of nearly VND28.2 trillion ($1.1 billion) in February.

Title: Vietnam's ultra-high-net-worth individuals increase by 2.4%

Vietcombank Remittance anticipates and responds to remittance inflows by analyzing labor export markets and adapting strategies, catering to Vietnamese export workers' needs and facilitating efficient fund transfers.

Title: E-commerce exports top $3.5B
Description: Vietnamese businesses exported VND80.7 trillion (US$3.5 billion) worth of goods through e-commerce channels last year, up 7% from 2021, as small players raced to take advantage of online sales.

Title: State budget revenue nears $33B in five months
Description: State budget collection in the January-May period was estimated at over VND769.6 trillion (US$32.75 billion), equivalent to 47.5% of the estimates for the whole year, the Ministry of Finance reported on Thursday.

Title: 11 hydropower plants shut down due to water shortage
Description: Eleven hydropower plants in northern Vietnam have shut down due to lack of water, summarily taking 5,000 megawatts out of the grid.

Title: Business activity stalled by load shedding
Description: Businesses in northern Vietnam are struggling to keep operations going amid frequent load shedding as demand for scant power surges.

Title: New securities trading accounts quadruple in May
Description: Nearly 105,000 stock trading accounts were opened in May, the highest number since last September and four times that of April, according to the Vietnam Securities Depository.

Title: Infrastructure upgrade needed to smoothen border trade with China
Description: Border gates with China are being overwhelmed by the trade between the two countries, and need infrastructure upgrades.

Title: Vietnam spends over $2B on animal feed, material imports in 5 months
Description: Vietnam spent US$2.04 billion to import animal feed and raw materials for the production of this kind of commodity in the first five months of this year, according to the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development (MARD).

Title: May industrial production index inches up 2.2%
Description: The index of industrial production (IIP) in May increased by 2.2% against the previous month, according to the General Statistics Office (GSO).

Title: Government firm on not extending 6-month VAT rebate
Description: The proposed VAT rebate was meant to be a short-term stimulant to the economy and therefore should not be extended, the government has insisted.

Title: Load shedding worsens plight of suburbs in sweltering Hanoi
Description: A surge in demand amid declining hydropower production has forced Vietnam Electricity to cut power supply to a Hanoi suburb to ensure system safety.

Title: Nearly $7B raised through gov't bond auctions in five months
Description: The State Treasury raised VND162.95 trillion (nearly $6.94 billion) worth of Government bonds via auctions on the Hanoi Stock Exchange (HNX) in the first five months of 2023, up 188.4% year-on-year.

Title: Lawmakers push government to utilize $42B in coffers
Description: Lawmakers are urging the government to speed up the use of VND1,025 trillion ($42.57 billion) in state coffers for urgent projects to boost economic recovery.

Title: Over 700 durian trucks stuck at Vietnam-China border
Description: Some 700 trucks, most of them carrying durian, are stuck trying to enter China from Vietnam’s Lang Son Province, thanks to high demand during the fruit’s harvest season.

Title: Rice export growth highest in 10 years
Description: Rice exports have increased by 49% year-on-year in the first five months to US$2.02 billion, the highest growth in 10 years.

Title: People struggle to find jobs amid tanking economy
Description: Many people find it difficult to get jobs as businesses downsize or simply do not have recruitment plans, a survey has found.

Title: Use state money of $42 B for the unemployed, lawmakers say
Description: Lawmakers proposed this week that the government should use its coffers, which now include over VND1,000 trillion ($42.57 billion) in cash, to support the unemployed through these tough economic times.

Title: Businesses need further government assistance amid economic challenges
Description: Analysts say that businesses need better access to low-interest loans in order to survive Vietnam’s ongoing economic challenges.

Title: GDP target unchanged for now: planning minister
Description: The government has not made any changes to its GDP growth target of 6.5% this year, with any future adjustment depending on results of the first six months.

Title: Rice, fruits bright spot amid Vietnam export slump
Description: While exports of textiles, wood products and seafood plummeted in the first five months of 2023, those of rice and fruits have risen.

Title: HCMC set for 5.87% economic growth in Q2
Description: The Ho Chi Minh City economy is forecast to grow at an 5.87% year-on-year in the second quarter, a jump from 0.7% in the first.

Title: Vietnam's ultra-rich population doubles over five years
Description: Over 1,000 people in Vietnam were considered "ultra-rich" in 2022, nearly double the figure recorded in 2017, according to the latest report by U.K. property consultancy Knight Frank.

Title: Vietnam posts trade surplus of $9.8B in five months
Description: Vietnam’s import-export value in the first five months of this year was estimated at $262.54 billion, down 14.7% year-on-year, with a trade surplus of $9.8 billion, according to the General Statistics Office (GSO).

Title: Business need 32 hours to complete each government procedure
Description: It takes a company 32.2 hours and VND3.8 million (US$162) on average to complete a single administrative procedure related to property development, a survey has found.

Title: CPI increases by 0.01% in May
Description: The General Statistics Office (GSO) on May 29 announced that the May consumer price index (CPI) increased by 0.01% month-on-month mostly due to increases in prices of food, electricity, and water.

Title: Vietnam invests over $316M abroad in 5 months
Description: Vietnam invested nearly $316.4 million abroad in the first five months of this year, equivalent to 93.5% of the figure recorded in the same period last year.

Title: Banks across the board cut deposit interest rates
Description: Over 20 banks have cut deposit interest rates, and the highest has fallen from 9% to 8.5%.

Title: Certain banks allowing loans above limit
Description: Some banks have allowed loans as much as six times higher than the set limit, according to a report by the State Audit of Vietnam.

Title: Banks to lower loan interest rates by 50 basis points
Description: Banks are set to cut loan interest rates on Monday on the directions of the central bank, which is seeking to speed up economic recovery.

Title: Electricity imports a fraction of demand: ministry
Description: Electricity imports from Laos and China account for only a fraction of the demand in northern Vietnam, where shortages are expected, according to the Ministry of Industry and Trade.

Title: Bad debt on the rise at banks
Description: Bad debt ratios at Vietnam’s commercial banks rose dramatically in the first quarter of the year as the property and finance sectors continued to struggle.

Title: Ha Tinh Province again looks for $1B urban complex developer
Description: The central province of Ha Tinh has cancelled the prequalification result of a VND24-trillion ($1.02 billion) urban project after both bidders decided to withdraw.

Title: HCMC export situation grim as recession hits demand
Description: HCMC's exports fell by more than 21% in the first four months of the year to US$12 billion.

Title: Lawmakers question electricity imports amid renewable surplus
Description: Lawmakers have asked the government why Vietnam has to import electricity from Laos and China when it has 4,600 megawatts of renewable energy readily available.

Title: India's Adani Group weighs $3B investment in Vietnam
Description: India's Adani Group is exploring the possibility to invest up to $3 billion in seaport and renewable energy projects in Vietnam, the Vietnamese government said in a statement on Wednesday.

Title: Government seeks lawmaker approval on VAT cut
Description: The Vietnamese government on Wednesday presented a proposal to the National Assembly to cut VAT from 10 to 8% to boost economic recovery.

Title: Vietnam shows significant improvement in business environment: EIU
Description: Vietnam jumped 12 places in the Economist Intelligence Unit (EIU)’s latest business environment rankings which measure the attractiveness of doing business in 82 economies with 91 crucial indicators.

Title: Central bank to cut deposit interest rate ceiling
Description: The State Bank of Vietnam (SBV) announced it would cut the interest rate ceiling on deposits of under six months to 5% a year starting Thursday.

Title: Remittances to HCMC likely to hit $7B in 2023
Description: Remittances to Ho Chi Minh City are expected to reach $7 billion in 2023, an annual increase of about 6-7%.

Title: Economic woes far from over: NA committee chairman
Description: Returning Vietnam’s economy to a state of healthy growth will remain a bridge too far this quarter, said Vu Hong Thanh, Chairman of the National Assembly Economic Committee.

Title: Dollar declines against dong
Description: The U.S. dollar fell against the Vietnamese dong Monday.

Title: Vietnam, Japan sign three ODA projects valued at $500M
Description: Vietnamese Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh and his Japanese counterpart Fumio Kishida witnessed the signing of three ODA projects with a total value of 61 billion yen (US$500 million) on Sunday.

Title: Vietnamese durian seller in Thailand faces jail term for tipping the scales
Description: A Vietnamese durian vendor in Thailand is facing a potential seven years in jail for using doctored weighing scales to trick customers.

Title: Life and business topsy-turvy amid blackouts
Description: Power outages in Ho Chi Minh City, Hanoi and the northern province of Bac Giang have turned daily life, business and production upside down over the past few days.

Title: Vietnam, Canada to increase bilateral trade turnover to $10B
Description: Vietnam and Canada have agreed to bolster trade and investment cooperation to bring the two countries' bilateral trade turnover to $10 billion.

Title: Cash-strapped big companies make fire sale of assets: government
Description: Some large enterprises have had to sell stakes and assets at low prices due to cash flow difficulties, the government has said in a report to the National Assembly.

Title: FDI sector posts over $14B in four-month trade surplus
Description: Despite an overall export decline due to the shortage of orders, foreign direct invested (FDI) businesses still posted more than $14 billion in trade surplus in the first four months.

Title: Inflation, bad debt keep interests rates high: SBV
Description: Inflationary pressure and banks’ concerns about rising bad debt have kept loan interest rates high, the State Bank of Vietnam (SBV) has said.

Title: HCMC's poor infrastructure unattractive to FDI
Description: Ho Chi Minh City is experiencing a decline in foreign direct investment as its limited supply of land and outdated infrastructure make the economic hub less attractive than competing localities.

Title: Government excludes property, banking sectors from VAT rebate proposal
Description: The government has excluded property, banking, securities, insurance, and telecommunications from the list of sectors to be given a 2% value-added tax rebate in July-December this year.

Title: Vietnam PM approves $135B power plan for 2030
Description: Vietnam's Prime Minister approved a long-awaited power plan for this decade that needs $134.7 billion of funding for new power plants and grids, the government said late on Monday, in a move that may help unlock billions of dollars of foreign investment.

Title: Finance Ministry stands firm on sugary drink tax
Description: The Ministry of Finance is sticking to its guns on imposing a special consumption tax on sugary drinks despite beverage businesses’ claims it will not prevent obesity.

Title: Developing HCMC int'l financial center will be ‘difficult’
Description: The Ministry of Planning and Investment is working with HCMC to develop an international financial center in the southern hub, which will not be easy, according to a government minister.

Title: Banks not passing on full interest rate cuts to borrowers
Description: Bank borrowers are complaining that they still have to pay high interests despite banks cutting rates, with reductions only being applied to new loans.

Title: Standard Chartered cuts Vietnam growth forecast to 6.5%
Description: Standard Chartered has reduced Vietnam’s GDP growth forecast for this year by 0.7 percentage points to 6.5%.

Title: Central bank says interest rates to remain high for now, seeks businesses’ ‘understanding’
Description: State Bank of Vietnam governor Nguyen Thi Hong said bank lending rates would be reduced at the appropriate time but remain high for now to achieve macro targets.

Title: HCMC invites international CEOs to 'tea party'
Description: Ho Chi Minh City plans to host a meeting at which 100 CEOs from major corporations around the globe will gather to discuss investment.

Title: Vietnam forex reserves to top $95B: forecast
Description: Vietnam’s foreign exchange reserves will rise back to US$95 billion this year, Moody’s Investor Service has forecast.

Title: Labor market to record 150,000 new jobs in Q2: ministry
Description: About 150,000 new jobs will be created in the second quarter of this year, including 28,200 in electronics and optical device manufacturing, according to the Ministry of Labor, Invalids and Social Affairs.

Title: Gold consumption down 12% in Q1
Description: Vietnamese consumed 17.2 tons of gold in the first quarter of this year, down 12% over the same period last year, according to the World Gold Council (WGC).

Title: Cash crunch prompts fire sales at large firms
Description: Big companies have had to sell off most of their assets at half their value due to a cash crunch, Minister of Planning and Investment Nguyen Chi Dung said Tuesday.

Title: Vietnam lawmakers call for further rate cut to prop up growth
Description: Vietnamese lawmakers on Tuesday urged the central bank to consider cutting policy rates further to support the economy and help the country meet its economic growth target for the year.

Title: China’s BYD plans Vietnam production base to export to Southeast Asia
Description: Electric vehicle maker BYD will set up a production base for electric cars and parts in Phu Tho Province to supply the domestic and Southeast Asian markets.

Title: Government set to pull cloak of anonymity from social media users
Description: The government is drafting new regulations that will require users of social media like Facebook, TikTok and YouTube to identify themselves to reduce objectionable content online frauds and scams.

Title: Newly registered enterprises in Laos increases sharply
Description: In 2022, Laos had a total of 18,076 newly registered enterprises, with a total registered capital of about US$7.5 billion, an increase of 42.94% compared to 2021, statistics of the country’s Ministry of Industry and Trade revealed.

Title: North set for power shortage this summer: Vietnam Electricity
Description: Northern Vietnam is set to face a power shortfall of 1,600-4,900 megawatts in May and June when hydropower production will be hit by the hot, dry weather.

Title: Four-month public capital disbursement reaches 14.66% of year's target
Description: More than 110.6 trillion VND (US$4.7 billion) of public investment was disbursed in the first four months of this year.

Title: SBV tells banks to further cut lending interest rates
Description: The State Bank of Vietnam is urging banks to further reduce loan interest rates in the coming months, said its deputy governors Dao Minh Tu.

Title: Central bank buys $4.9B to pump up foreign exchange reserves
Description: The State Bank of Vietnam (SBV) has bought US$4.9 billion from commercial banks in the first four months to increase the national foreign exchange reserves.

Title: Vietnam sees 41 new projects abroad licensed in last four months
Description: In the first four months of this year, Vietnam saw 41 new projects abroad licensed with the investment from Vietnam reaching $140 million, a decline of 51% compared with that of the same period last year.

Title: Get-rich-quick courses becoming get-debt-quick schemes
Description: Many netizens with dreams of becoming millionaires overnight followed “specialists” on the Internet only to find themselves in crippling debt.

Title: Exports down 12% in four months
Description: Vietnam's exports totaled US$108.57 billion in the first four months of this year, a year-on-year decrease of 11.8%, the General Statistics Office announced.

Title: April’s consumer price index down 0.34% m-o-m
Description: The consumer price index (CPI) in April decreased by 0.34% month-on-month, but increased by 2.81% year-on-year, according to the General Statistics Office (GSO).

Title: Newly registered businesses peak in April
Description: The number of new businesses set a record high in April at 15,967, according to the General Statistics Office of Vietnam.

Title: HCMC leader says economy improving
Description: The Ho Chi Minh City economy has had many bright spots in April, especially in manufacturing and retail trade, its People’s Committee chairman Phan Van Mai has said.

Title: Retailers seek to stimulate demand during long holiday
Description: Offering discounts and selling regional specialties are part of plans made by retail stores in HCMC to attract shoppers during the long holiday weekend.

Title: Parkson Vietnam files for bankruptcy
Description: Mall operator Parkson Vietnam on Friday filed for bankruptcy in Ho Chi Minh City, ending its 18 years of operations with million-dollar losses.

Title: Laos raises minimum wage for workers
Description: The Lao Government has decided to raise the monthly minimum wage from LAK1.2 million (nearly US$70) to LAK1.3 million starting on May 1 to ease difficulties facing workers amid soaring inflation and economic uncertainties.

Title: ‘Unfair’ green requirements hurt Vietnamese exporters
Description: Vietnamese exporters are facing challenges in meeting developed countries' green energy and carbon-emissions standards.

Title: Foreign corporations in Vietnam worried about global minimum tax
Description: Major foreign corporations are concerned that the proposed global minimum tax will make investing in Vietnam less profitable, according to the Ministry of Planning and Investment.

Title: FDI flow bounces back
Description: So far this year, foreign direct investment (FDI) channeled into Vietnam neared US$8.9 billion, with new capital surging after a slight decrease in the first three months.

Title: Vietnam central bank plans loan restructuring for struggling businesses
Description: Vietnam's central bank will restructure loans for some businesses facing difficulties, including delaying loan repayments, the government said, as it seeks to shore up a slowing economy.

Title: HCMC sees surge in remittances
Description: Remittances to Ho Chi Minh City increased by 19% year-on-year in the first quarter to over US$2.1 billion, according to the State Bank of Vietnam.

Title: Average workers' monthly income reaches $336
Description: The average monthly income of Vietnamese workers in the first quarter of 2023 was VND7.9 million ($336), the Ministry of Planning and Investment reported.

Title: Three foreign groups plan to pour $3.7B into Vietnam
Description: Three foreign groups unveiled plans to pour $3.7 billion into Vietnam at a meeting with Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh in Hanoi Saturday, according to the Ministry of Planning and Investment.

Title: PM orders measures to facilitate finance, banking activities
Description: Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh held a working session with the State Bank of Vietnam Saturday to review and step up the issuance of two important circulars related to the finance-banking sector.

Title: PM pledges support if global minimum tax applied
Description: The government will provide solutions and support to help investors and new projects if the proposed global minimum tax is applied.

Title: Traveler scores $250,000 worth of tickets for $17,000 after ANA airline error
Description: A man bagged US$250,000 worth of airline tickets for just $17,000 after fares on an All Nippon Airways (ANA) website were listed ultra cheaply due to a currency conversion error.

Title: Pay cuts, layoffs continue as businesses wait on economic recovery
Description: Many businesses are cutting salaries and letting go of employees while waiting for the economy to turn the corner.

Title: HCMC ranks 9th globally in millionaire growth rate
Description: Ho Chi Minh City saw the ninth fastest growth rate globally in the number of millionaires last year, according to residence and citizenship advisory firm Henley and Partners.

Title: HCMC's exports hits 22-year low
Description: Export turnover in HCMC reached over US$10 billion in Q1, a 17% decrease year-by-year, and also the sharpest decline in 22 years.

Title: Global minimum tax will hurt Vietnam investment: Samsung
Description: The proposed global minimum tax would weaken the international business environment in Vietnam by eliminating preferential tax policies for foreign direct investment (FDI), said Samsung Vietnam CEO Choi Joo Ho.

Title: Government endorses 2% VAT cut
Description: The government has green-lighted a cut in value-added tax from 10% to 8% for the rest of this year, and will present it to lawmakers for approval.

Title: Vietnam’s green economy expected to reach $300B by 2050
Description: Vietnam has set a target of increasing its green economy's contribution to GDP from $6.7 billion in 2020 to $300 billion by 2050, Minister of Planning and Investment Nguyen Chi Dung has said.

Title: Vietnam’s GDP forecast to rank second in ASEAN
Description: Vietnam’s GDP is projected to grow 5.8% this year, sharing the second position with Cambodia in the region, only after the Philippines, according to the International Monetary Fund (IMF).

Title: HCMC economy facing hardships
Description: Ho Chi Minh City’s economy has failed to fully recover from the pandemic and faced a slew of newer challenges, Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh said.

Title: Vietnamese durian prices double in Japan
Description: A kilogram of Vietnamese durian currently sells for $17-18 in Japanese supermarkets, double last year’s price due to higher import costs and more demand than supply.

Title: When consultants con prospective depositors into buying insurance
Description: Nga and her husband went to a bank to open a savings account, but the poor couple are now saddled with insurance premium payments of VND50 million a year.

Title: Government approves tax extensions to boost economy
Description: The government has extended the payment deadlines for value-added and income taxes and land rents for a fifth time to support the economy amid the global headwinds.

Title: Slowing realty market hinders big banks in bad debt recovery
Description: Having hold of a large amount of bad debts mortgaged by real estate, Vietnam’s four biggest State-owned banks are urgently recovering the debts, but the work remains tough for them due to the slowdown of the realty market.

Title: Durians selling for half usual price fool online buyers
Description: Durians selling for VND35,000 ($1.49) per kilogram, half their usual price, are being advertised by online sellers as the best quality, but customers are not receiving their orders.

Title: President calls for sustainable Vietnamese business in Laos
Description: President Vo Van Thuong has asked the Vietnamese community in Laos to set its sights on long-term sustainable business growth even though weathering current short-term difficulties will be difficult.

Title: $4B LNG-fired plant delayed by electricity price haggle
Description: Construction of the US$4-billion Bac Lieu liquefied natural gas-fired power plant in the south has not begun even three years after its approval due to a disagreement in electricity selling price.

Title: Telecom operators want OTT players to pay for use of networks
Description: Vietnamese telecom operators want OTT communications service providers to pay for using their networks, which they use to deliver their services but end up competing with them.

Title: Exports-imports via Lao Cai border gate thrive in Q1
Description: Export-import activities via Lao Cai at the China border thrived in the first quarter this year, reaching nearly US$186 million, the local customs agency reported.

Title: Unemployment rises in Q1 as manufacturing orders fall
Description: Some 149,000 workers lost their jobs in the last quarter due to declining orders, 13% more than in the previous quarter, according to the General Statistics Office.

Title: Vietnam exports 1.7 million tonnes of rice in Q1
Description: Vietnam exported 1.7 million tonnes of rice in Q1 worth over $900 million, a 19% increase in quantity and 30% rise in value over the same period last year, according to Vietnam Customs.

Title: Vietnam eyes $30B in food, food stuff exports annually
Description: Vietnam has issued a national action plan on building a sustainable food and food stuff system to 2030, with a goal of maintaining the export turnover of over $30 billion each year.

Title: Australian financial firm sees surging interest in Vietnam investment
Description: Australian financial company Acuity Funding has seen the number of investment requests for projects in Vietnam tripling between February and March, showing increased interest in the country.

Title: HCMC work permit issuance remains tardy, foreign businesses complain
Description: Ho Chi Minh City (HCMC) authorities say they have sped up the issuing of work permits to foreign workers, but businesses say the process still takes too long.

Title: Businesses complain fire safety rules too tough
Description: Enterprises are calling on the government to loosen fire safety regulations, which they say are unrealistic and a hindrance to doing business.

Title: Durian fastest growing fruit export to China
Description: Durian was the fastest-growing export to China among fruits in the first two months of this year, rising by 291% year-on-year to US$56.9 million.

Title: Russia calls Vietnam leading partner in Southeast Asia
Description: As the only Southeast Asian country to sign a free trade agreement with the Eurasian Economic Union (EAEU), Vietnam is Russia's leading business partner in the area, Russia's Deputy PM Dmitry Chernyshenko said.

Title: Corporate bonds worth $1.1B issued in March
Description: The corporate bond market is showing signs of recovery with a notable increase in both the number of issuers and the value of issued bonds in March.

Title: Vietnam ready to export first batch of sweet potatoes to China
Description: Vietnam’s 70 sweet potato cultivation areas and 13 packaging facilities have been licensed to export to China, reported the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development (MARD)’s Plant Protection Department.

Title: Electricity prices will rise: industry minister
Description: The Ministry of Industry and Trade is considering an electricity price hike following the huge loss reported by state utility Vietnam Electricity (EVN) for last year.

Title: Apax Leaders reopens English teaching centers, swaps debt for real estate
Description: Egroup, which has begun restructuring its English language school Apax Leaders, has reopened 31 centers and agreed to pay 300 creditors and investors in the form of real estate.

Title: Growth stymied by global downturn: HCMC chairman
Description: Ho Chi Minh City chairman Phan Van Mai blames stifled growth in the southern hub on low external demand created by a sinking global economy.

Title: Manufacturing dips after minor gains
Description: Vietnam’s manufacturing activity dropped in March after a marginal climb in February as business continue struggling amid weakened global demand.

Title: Vietnam loses billionaire on Forbes world’s richest list
Description: Vietnam has six billionaires on the 2023 Forbes list of the planet’s richest people, down from seven last year.

Title: Malaysian clothing store in chaos as hundreds seek sales promotion
Description: Around 500 people swarmed a clothing store in Malaysian city Shah Alam in the weekend to buy discounted items for as low as MYR1 (23 U.S. cents), which caused chaos and required police intervention.

Title: Vietnam's economy to grow by 6.6% this year: OECD
Description: Vietnam's economy will grow by 6.6% this year and at a similar rate in 2024, according to a report released by the Organization for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD).

Title: Economic difficulties to persist in Q2: ministry
Description: Economic difficulties would persist in the second quarter of the year, posing a challenge to meeting the year's GDP growth target, the Ministry of Planning and Investment predicted.

Title: Gasoline prices increase
Description: Gasoline prices slightly rose on Monday after falling to its lowest in 2 months on March 21.

Title: Bankrupt FTX raises Vietnamese investors’ hopes with email
Description: Bankrupt cryptocurrency exchange FTX has sent emails to many Vietnamese investors saying it seeks to refund their money.

Title: Vietnam eyes 50% increase in private businesses to 1.5 mln
Description: The government plans to have 1.5 million privately owned businesses by 2025 to make the private sector an important driving force for the economy.

Title: Vietnam, Israel conclude FTA negotiations
Description: Vietnam and Israel announced on Sunday the conclusion of negotiations for their free trade agreement (FTA), creating a premise for the two countries to sign the deal right this year.

Title: China extends border trading hours to reduce congestion
Description: China has extended its trading hours at border gates with Vietnam by one hour to 7 p.m. every day to reduce the congestion of container trucks carrying Vietnamese fruit.

Title: 800 container trucks stuck at Vietnam-China border
Description: Over 800 container trucks were stuck at Vietnam’s border gates with China in Lang Son Province Thursday amid an increase in the transportation of agriculture produce in the middle of the harvest season.

Title: Investment in Vietnamese startups down 56%
Description: Investment in Vietnamese startups reached $634 million in 2022, down 56% over the previous year due to the impact of global economic fluctuations.

Title: Central bank to cut deposit interest rate ceiling from Monday
Description: The central bank on Friday said it would cut caps on interest rates of dong-denominated deposits from April 3, by 0.5 percentage points to between 0.5% and 6.0% depending on maturities.

Title: Vietnam central bank to keep monetary policy flexible in 2023, tame inflation
Description: Vietnam's central bank pledged on Friday to keep monetary policy flexible for the rest of the year to support economic stability amid external challenges, with space for more interest rate cuts while it prioritizes keeping inflation in check.

Title: HCMC economy grows 0.7% in Q1
Description: HCMC’s gross regional domestic product (GRDP) grew just 0.7 % in the first quarter, the lowest among Vietnam’s five municipal cities.

Title: Vietnam-grown Musang King durian more expensive than imports
Description: A kilogram of Vietnam-grown Musang King durian flesh now costs VND1.5-1.8 million ($64-$76), 20% higher than imports of the same varietal.

Title: Don't rely on tax incentives for FDI: analysts
Description: Analysts say Vietnam should stop depending on tax incentives to attract FDI and instead focus on improving the business environment and quality of labor as a minimum corporate tax looms.

Title: GDP growth slows in Q1
Description: Vietnams’ GDP growth slowed to 3.32% year-on-year in the first quarter, the second lowest growth rate in the last 12 years.

Title: Vietnam struggles to auction outdated gasoline
Description: Vietnam is finding it difficult to sell 102 million liters of RON92, an out-of-date gasoline the country wants to replace with more RON95 in the national reserve.

Title: Deposit interest rates tumble
Description: Banks have cut deposit interest rates from 0.1-0.7 percentage points in the past two weeks, bringing the general interest rate down to less than 9% a year.

Title: Sanctions hit Vietnamese exports to Russia
Description: Vietnam’s exports to Russia fell by nearly 60% year-on-year to US$205 million in the first two months of this year.

Title: Sex messages coax phone users into dubious downloads
Description: Vietnamese cell phone users have been receiving a spate of sexual messages from strangers in recent times that also ask them to click on links.

Title: Industrial production shows glimpses of recovery
Description: The manufacturing sector is showing signs of revival but a full-blown recovery is only likely in the second half of this year at the earliest, analysts said.

Title: Inflation likely to be 3.9-4.8% this year: finance ministry
Description: The Ministry of Finance expects 3.9-4.8% inflation this year as against a target of 4.5%.

Title: Vietnam to block payment for unlicensed games
Description: The Ministry of Information and Communications said it will deploy solutions to block the payment for unauthorized games in the country.

Title: Durian prices plunge by half
Description: Durian prices have plunged by half in nearly two months as harvest season approaches and supply is abundant.

Title: An Dong Plaza wears deserted look as shopkeepers go on strike
Description: Vendors have closed some 2,700 stalls at An Dong Plaza, a major fashion and footwear wholesale venue in Ho Chi Minh City, in protest against what they say are high rents.

Title: Mexico a springboard for Vietnamese goods to enter the US: ambassador
Description: If Vietnamese businesses strengthen export and investment in Mexico, it will be easier for them to penetrate into the U.S. market, said the Mexican ambassador to Vietnam.

Title: Tax on sugary drinks proposed for the benefit of people’s health: NA chairman
Description: Vuong Dinh Hue, chairman of the National Assembly, told American businesses Thursday that the special consumption tax on sweetened beverages was proposed for the benefit of people’s health and not for earning revenue.

Title: New global tax to diminish Vietnam’s FDI attractiveness
Description: The global minimum corporate tax rate of 15%, which is set to be applied next year in Vietnam, will likely make the country less attractive in drawing in foreign direct investment.

Title: An Dong Plaza vendors shut their doors to demand free rent
Description: Nearly 2,700 stalls at An Dong Plaza, a major fashion and footwear wholesale venue in Ho Chi Minh City, closed their doors on Wednesday as vendors demanded free rent for the year amid plunging sales.

Title: US Fed delivers small rate hike amid global banking turmoil
Description: The Federal Reserve on Wednesday raised interest rates by a quarter of a percentage point, but indicated it was on the verge of pausing further increases in borrowing costs after the recent collapse of two U.S. banks.

Title: Major US companies laud Vietnam as strategic market
Description: A large delegation of big U.S. businesses – including Boeing, Meta and SpaceX – has said it regards Vietnam as a strategic market and supports the government’s digital and green transformation goals.

Title: Vietnam to reduce unofficial exports over land borders
Description: Vietnam will begin reducing its unofficial exports in 2025 to prevent congestion at land borders, especially with China, according to a draft government decree.

Title: Vietnam seeks new investor incentives as cross-border tax rules loom
Description: Vietnam has set up a special panel to find ways to stay competitive for investors when new OECD cross-border tax rules take effect, its central bank said on Tuesday, amid concerns it could negate the benefits of its current tax incentives.

Title: Japanese retailers expand in Vietnam, targeting affluent
Description: Targeting consumers not much affected by the difficult economic situation, Japanese retailers are opening more stores in Vietnam.

Title: US companies show ‘remarkable’ commitment to Vietnam: Ambassador
Description: American companies including Boeing, Meta and Netflix have demonstrated “remarkable” commitment in Vietnam by seeking local investment opportunities, said the U.S. Ambassador.

Title: Gasoline prices dive to 2-month low
Description: Gasoline prices fell to the lowest since Jan. 11 on Tuesday afternoon, while diesel continued to decline.

Title: ‘Pay with Pi’ shop pops up on Shopee

(NASDAQ: BYND), a global plant-based protein company, today announced the grand opening of its new state-of-the-art manufacturing facility in the Jiaxing Economic & Technological Development Zone (JXEDZ) near Shanghai. As Beyond Meat's first end-to-end manufacturing facility outside the U.S., the cutting-edge plant in Jiaxing is expected to significantly increase the speed and scale in which the company can produce and distribute its products within the region while also improving Beyond Meat's cost structure and sustainability of operations.

Title: Land fevers: causes, consequences and solutions
Description: Land fevers arise once in a while. Consider, for example, price surges in Phu Quoc (Kien Giang), Van Don (Quang Ninh), and Bac Van Phong (Khanh Hoa), when the Government planned to establish special administrative-economic zones there. Kien Giang and Quang Ninh had to suspend land use right transfer to tackle the land fevers. Many places about to embark on new zoning plans also experienced land fevers, such as those triggered by Long Thanh Airport (Dong Nai) and Hon Quan Airport (Binh Phuoc). However, some land fevers do not spread as the localities where they take place do not have sufficiently large realty markets.

Title: Hong Kong Baptist University-led research reveals hyocholic acids are promising agents for diabetes prediction and treatment

Title: Cordlife launches OptiQ: A first-of-its-kind corneal lenticule banking service in Singapore

Amazon announced that it is extending the waiver of professional selling account subscription fees for new and existing sellers, until 30 June 2021. Description: The Thailand Board of Investment (BOI) approved five large-scale projects and measures to strengthen Thailand's agricultural sector and agro-industry in line with the BCG (Bioeconomy, Circular Economy, and Green Economy) model.

Title: Vietnam's rice export in 6 months reached nearly 3.5 million tons, up 18%
Description: The data from Agro Processing and Market Development Authority (Agrotrade) showed that Vietnam exported nearly 3.5 million tonnes of rice in 6 months, worth US$1.71 billion.

Title: McKinsey & Fitch Ratings highly appreciate Vietnam’s economic resilience

Meanwhile, Fitch Ratings says that Vietnam is stand out among Asia’s frontier and emerging markets this year in terms of its economic recovery and success in curbing the coronavirus pandemic.

Title: Vietnam and Japan trade promotion conference in support industries to be held on July 7
Description: The Vietnam Ministry of Industry and Trade will hold a teleconference for trade promotion in support industries between Vietnam and Japan on July 7. This event is expected to attract about 30-40 companies from both countries.

Title: Samsung likely to offset smartphone losses with strong chip biz in Q2
Description: Samsung Electronics is expected to announce better-than-expected earnings guidance for its second quarter, based on its robust chip business that would offset losses in its smartphone and display businesses amid the novel Covid-19 pandemic.

Title: Vietnam's retail sales and service revenue in June up 6.2%

Title: Vietnam's industrial production slightly rebounding
Description: Data from the General Statistics Office (GSO) showed that Vietnam's industrial production was greatly affected by Covid-19 in the first half of 2020 but has gradually bounced back since May.

Title: Vietnamese businesses borrow 65% of its equity?
Description: Thousands of listed firms in Vietnam are heavily leveraged. But under expert's scrutinizes, this is not a pressing problem.

Title: New foreign investment wave begins in Vietnam despite Covid-19
Description: Under the impacts of Covid-19 and the US-China trade tensions, the new wave of foreign investments into Vietnam has become more visible. Specifically, there have been outstanding foreign ventures expanding in Vietnam in the first half of the year.

Description: Foxconn, Apple's largest iPhone manufacturer, has been making clear moves on increasing investment in Vietnam. Does that indicate Apple has chosen Vietnam as a new location to make iPhone?

Title: New Law on Investment in Vietnam: Favour of foreign investment
Description: The Vietnamese National Assembly has adopted the new Law on Investment, with new rules in favour of foreign investment, including from the US, which is expected to surge in Vietnam in the time to come.

Title: Investing in digital currency: Remains illegal in Vietnam
Description: Investing in digital currency remains illegal in Vietnam, and those who encourage people to invest in schemes are considered offenders.

Title: Vietnamese Company Creates World’s First Biodegradable Coffee Face Mask Named AirX
Description: The world’s first biodegradable face mask comprised almost entirely of discarded waste from large-scale coffee manufacturers.

Title: Thailand’s Gulf to acquire two Vietnamese wind farms
Description: Gulf Energy Development Plc set by The Stock Exchange of Thailand (SET) has announced buying two wind farms in Vietnam worth a total of US$200 million.

Description: Covid-19 certainly slowed down the Vietnamese economy growth. However, by the end of the day, the little South East Asia country still came out on top by being one of the few positive-growth countries in the first half of 2020.

Description: At an online conference between the Vietnamese Government and localities on July 2, Prime Minister Nguyen Xuan Phuc concluded that the disbursement of public investment should be one of the criteria to measure the performance of agencies, sectors and localities.

Title: Fitch Solutions revises Vietnam's 2020 GDP growth to 3%
Description: On July 1, Fitch Solutions released in its latest report that Vietnam's GDP growth in 2020 may reach 3%, slightly up from 2.8% previously.

Title: Boeing to cease 747 'Queen of the Skies' production after 50 years
Description: Boeing is ready to cease the production of the Boeing 747 jumbo jet after 50 years according to Bloomberg.

Title: 5G paves way for innovation in all economic sectors in Vietnam

Title: Vietnam stressed the goal for EU to remove "yellow card" over illegal fishing
Description: The removal of the European Commission (EC) "yellow card" over illegal, unreported and unregulated (IUU) fishing is crucial for Vietnam to regain world prestige and fulfill the goal to maintain sustainable development of Vietnam's marine economy through 2030.

Title: Vietnam, Japan eye stronger trade ties
Description: Vietnamese Minister of Industry and Trade Tran Tuan Anh and Japanese Minister of State for Economic and Fiscal Policy Nishimura Yasutoshi on July 2 discussed ways to boost trade between the two countries.

Title: Fishery export down 10 percent in June
Description: Vietnam's fishery export value contracted 10 percent in June to only 626 million USD, following a sharp decline of 16 percent in May.

Title: EVFTA Agreement: Take off the rose-tinted glasses
Description: EVFTA offers lowered taxes, but in order to be exported to the EU, all goods must satisfy the industry’s specific requirements.

Title: Southern key economic localities showed signs of recovery in the context of COVID-19
Description: Despite COVID-19's negative impacts upon all aspects of the country's economy, Vietnam's southern provinces' economy continues to show signs of recovery.

Description: The purchasing managers indexes (PMIs) of Asian countries witnessed slight pumps  despite the disparity of speed in June and Vietnam is within the group showing the most positive signals in manufacturing recovery, according to Bloomberg.

Description: Despite many challenges, the Vietnamese Government aims at maintaining the Consumer Price Index (CPI) at not exceeding 4% and strives towards achieving economic growth of 4% for this year.

Description: Over the first six months of 2020, China still played as Vietnam’s largest import market despite turnover only reached a mere of USD 34.8 billion, a slight decrease year on year, VOV reported.

Description: The new solar power plant of Sharp's Energy Unit has an output of approximately 45MW, with annual power generation capacity estimated at 76,373 MWh/year.

Description: On June 30, Chairman of the Government Office and Chairman of the Advisory Council for the Administrative Procedure Reform Mai Tien Dung and Chairman of the European Chamber of Commerce in Vietnam (EuroCham) Nicolas Audier co-hosted a dialogue with the European business community in Hanoi.

Description: According to the General Statistics Office, Vietnam's consumer price index (CPI) has seen a year-on-year increase of 4.19% during the first six months of 2020, reaching the peak in the 2016-2020 period.

Description: On June 29, the leading business and financial website Bloomberg ran an article highlighting the robust growth of the Vietnamese economy despite the negative impact of the Covid-19 outbreak.

Title: Vietnam GDP increased by 1.81% in the first six months of 2020
Description: Figures released by the General Statistics Office (GSO) show that Vietnam's GDP has risen by 1.81% in the first six months of 2020.

Description: After more than 1 year of implementing the Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP), in the first quarter of 2020, Vietnam's trade surplus to these markets has doubled over the same period.

Title: Philippines drops multinational rice purchase as vietnam resumes exports
Description: The Philippine government has dropped a plan to import up to 300,000 tonnes of rice from various governments as its traditional main supplier, Vietnam, has resumed selling grains, the agriculture department said late on Saturday.

Title: PM urges Hanoi to become one of East Asia centres by 2045

Title: S. Korea: Independent committee advises prosecution not to indict Samsung heir in succession case

Title: Nestlé Vietnam and La Vie join forces for zero-waste future

Title: Sustainability - Key factors for Vietnam’s fashion and textile manufacturing industries

Description: Lazada, the Southeast Asian branch of Chinese e-commerce firm Alibaba Group Holding, announced on Friday (June 26) that it would replace its CEO.

Significant reductions in passenger numbers have resulted in planes flying empty, which in turn massively reduced revenues for airlines and forced many airlines to lay off employees or at the risk of bankruptcy.

Title: AEON executive officer highly appreciates Vietnamese “thieu” lychees

Title: Covid-19 changes consumer buying behaviors in Vietnam
Description: In Vietnam, many food products have been purchased online since coronavirus outbreak.

Description: On June 23, Deputy Prime Minister Vu Duc Dam hosted a reception for the Vietnam Business Council for Sustainable Development (VBCSD).

Description: As many as 15 Vietnamese firms are taking part in the Virtual Healthcare and Hygiene Expo 2020, which is being held from June 22 to 26 by the Federation of Indian Chambers of Commerce and Industry (FICCI).

Vietnam Government finds ADB one of the leading sponsors in terms of financial support, technical assistance and consulting.

Title: Apple to remove thousands of unlicensed games from Chinese App Store

And the U.S tech giant Apple has informed developers who offer iPhone games in China that they are now required to obtain a license from the Chinese government in order to continue offering those games in the Chinese App Store.

Title: Samsung Vietnam to organise largest recruitment test in 2020

Title: Vietnam and New Zealand target USD 1.7 billion of trade value in 2020

Title: Reuters: Samsung denies reports of the transfer of China display output to Vietnam

Description: The U.S-based tech giant Qualcomm Incorporated seems to conduct research and plan for its modems and other smartphone radio front-end chips for current and next-generation cellular technologies with the move to Hanoi, Vietnam.

Description: Although Vietnamese agricultural exporters are the ones who really expect to leverage the EU-Vietnam Free Trade Agreement (EVFTA), an expert from RMIT University Vietnam warns that "it will be no small feat to seize the opportunity".

Description: Luxshare Precision Industry (Luxshare-ICT), assembler of Apple's AirPods wireless earphones in Vietnam, is hiring thousands of new workers.

The investigations concern in particular the mandatory use of Apple's own proprietary in-app purchase system and restrictions on the ability of developers to inform iPhone and iPad users of alternative cheaper purchasing possibilities outside of apps.

Title: Jetstar Pacific's brand name changed into Pacific Airlines
Description: According to Vietnam Airlines, Jetstar Pacific will change its brand name to Pacific Airlines, with a new logo and brand identity.

Description: At the 14th National Assembly’s on-going ninth session on June 15, delegates continued discussing on issues related to socio-economic development and state budget in Vietnam.

Title: Vietnam stock market records unprecedented day of its history reaching US $1 billion

Title: Vietnam health care products yearn profit amid the pandemic
Description: During the pandemic, Vietnam's health care sector still sees a strong growth in revenue while many industries had almost incurred lost or gained no profit.

Title: Vietnam's Ministry of Finance to strictly supervise rapid capital increase and individual issuance cases
Description: In June 2020's plan on the management of financial markets and financial services, Vietnam's Ministry of Finance stated that it will closely monitor cases of the rapid capital increases and cases of private issuance but concurrently create favorable conditions for businesses.

Description: Early in June 2020, Vinamilk, the largest dairy company in Vietnam, has successfully signed a contract to export a large consignment of 85 product containers including: Set of 3 premium seed soymilk and Vinamilk's milk tea to Korea market.

Title: Vietnam trade surplus reached nearly USD 4 billion in 5 months
Description: According to the General Department of Custom, the trade balance of Vietnam's goods in the first 5 months of the year had a surplus of USD 3.53 billion.

Title: PM welcomes Chinese firms to invest in Vietnam
Description: On June 12, Prime Minister Nguyen Xuan Phuc hosted a reception in Hanoi for Chinese businesses leaders who are investing in garment and textile, high-quality fibre, engine components and automobile tyres in Vietnam.

Title: Government to develop policies to promote key economic regions in Vietnam
Description: Recently, Prime Minister Nguyen Xuan Phuc has requested relevant ministries and localities to develop proper policies to promote key economic regions to drive post-pandemic economic growth in Vietnam.

Title: Indonesia seeks to take advantage of economic opportunities in Vietnam post-COVID-19
Description: According to Indonesian Ambassador to Vietnam Ibnu Hadi, Indonesian businesses should strive to take advantage of more business opportunities in Vietnam post-COVID-19 to boost exports to this market.

Title: Vietnam automobile sales surged 62% in May after social distancing
Description: According to the data from the Vietnam Automobile Manufacturers’ Association (VAMA), Vietnam automobile sales surged 62% month-on-month in May following the end of social distancing measures.

Description: During a phone conversation with the president of Exxon Mobil LNG Market Development Inc Irtiza Sayyed on Thursday, Prime Minister Nguyen Xuan Phuc said Vietnam welcomes the world's energy giant to invest in Vietnam.

Title: Vietnam to begin importing live pigs from Thailand from June 12
Description: From June 12, the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development (MARD) has allowed businesses to import live pigs from Thailand. This move is to cool down pork prices which have skyrocketed in the domestic market recently.

Description: A draft of the Resolution on reduction of corporate income tax payable in 2020 for enterprises was presented by Minister of Finance Dinh Tien Dung  on June 11. According to the draft, small businesses could have 30% of corporate income tax to be reduced.

Title: Vietnam's litchi qualified to prevail the strictest market in the world
Description: After standard cultivation, the qualified litchis are experiencing the harvest season to prepare for exporting to the Japanese market.

Title: India Today: Firms moving from China to Vietnam is a lesson for India
Description: According to India Today, Vietnam has been emerging as a role model country in the fight against COVID-19.

Title: Policies for Vietnam to catch opportunities from EU market after EVFTA and EVIPA

In this context, there are certain policies for Vietnam to take advantage of new opportunities in trade and investments from the EU market.

Title: EVFTA: National Assembly deliberates over ratification of EU trade deal
Description: The National Assembly officially examined the ratification of the EU-Vietnam Free Trade Agreement (EVFTA) at the opening sitting of the 14th National Assembly’s ninth session on May 20.

Title: Vietnam wins the deal of 60,000 ton of rice supply to the Philippines

And Vietnam's 60,000 tons of rice will be shipped to the Philippines as a part of a 300,000-ton government-to-government rice tender held on June 8.

Viet Nam will emerge the least affected with its lead in unwinding measures as compared to other nations in ASEAN, although it is not immune to the sharp slowdown in trade flows.

Title: Vietnam's imports of computers, electronic products and components exceed USD 21 billion
Description: Statistics of the Ministry of Industry and Trade showed that imports of computers, electronic products, and components increased 8.7%, boasting the largest import value with a turnover of US $ 21.78 billion.

Title: Vinamilk and Kido to establish beverages joint venture
Description: Vinamilk and packaged food producer Kido Group Corporation have agreed to establish a company to produce ice cream and beverages.

Title: Vietnam's wind power sector expected to thrive
Description: Experts forecast Vietnam’s wind power sector would further grow in line with the Government’s stronger regulatory support announced recently and rising investor interest.

Title: The north economic triangle's Quang Ninh expects economy prospers in May
Description: By the end of May 2020, Quang Ninh’s index of industrial production (IIP) rose by 2.04% compared to April and 5.62% over the same period last year.

Title: Online trade exchange conference between Vietnam and Japan to be held on June 30

Title: Vietnam banks optimistic about charter capital hike in 2020

Title: South Korea's CJ CGV to divest from Vietnamese subsidiary
Description: CJ CGV will dispose of its stake in a Vietnamese real estate investment subsidiary to improve its financial structure, which has weakened in the wake of the new coronavirus crisis.

Title: Vietnam digital economy expected to contribute 20 percent of GDP by 2025

Title: World Bank says the global economy to shrink by 5.2% this year

Title: Customs reforms tax management policy accompanies with enterprises
Description: The Covid-19 pandemic happened unexpectedly and spread globally, greatly impacting the production and business activities of importing and exporting goods of enterprises. To timely share difficulties and facilitate businesses to the maximum, from the first days of the outbreak, Customs authorities promptly advised and promulgated regulations and guidelines related to tax management policies.

Title: Vietnam's e-commerce platforms Tiki, Sendo apply for merger
Description: The merger will make the race in the e-commerce market more exciting.

Title: Ho Chi Minh City apartment supply shows signs of recovery in May
Description: Ho Chi Minh City apartment supply in May showed signs of recovery from Covid-19 impacts with a six-fold increase over April.

Title: Covid-19 changes how Vietnamese shop

Title: HSBC: EVFTA to boost up Vietnam's GDP growth
Description: The EU-Vietnam free trade agreement will increase Vietnam’s annual GDP growth by 0.1 percentage points and boost exports of various sectors, HSBC says.

Title: Hanoi's 23 industrial clusters to be handed over to investors in late June

Title: Vietnamese dragon fruit to compete with Indonesian dragon fruit in Chinese market
Description: Indonesia recently obtained permission to export dragon fruit to the Chinese market. As previously the entire supply of imported dragon fruit came from Vietnam alone, this opens a competition between Vietnamese dragon fruit and Indonesia dragon fruit in China.

Title: EuroCham: EVFTA marks beginning of EU-Vietnam fruitful relations
Description: The ratification of the European Union-Vietnam Free Trade Agreement (EVFTA) by the National Assembly signifies the start of a new phase in the relationship between Vietnam and the EU, according to the European Chamber of Commerce in Vietnam (EuroCham).

Title: Indonesia scholar: Vietnam's COVID-19 success makes the country strategic investment destination
Description: The General Secretary of Indonesia Literature Forum assessed Vietnam is a strategic country to invest follow its success in containing the COVID-19.

Title: Mitsubishi plans to develop second automobile factory in Binh Dinh province

Title: Foreigners allowed to own homes in 22 Hanoi commercial housing projects

Recently, Mekong Delta has been strengthening connectivity and cooperation in high-tech agriculture development.
