Description: Vingroup has turned a startup venture into a newly industrial real estate investment.

Title: Vietnam economy in 2020, keeping taking off incredibly or not ?
Description: Vietnam is expected to take economic advantages in 2020 following good results in 2019. Experts and companies forecast the country's economic prospects this year both opportunities and challenges faced the country.

Title: How Asia fend off hoarders amidst coronavirus panic?
Description: Authorities from Japan to Thailand to India among others are making efforts to bar their citizens to store up commodities due to the fear of the novel coronavirus or Covid-19 outbreak recently.

Title: Vietnam’s e-commerce market to surpass US$17bn in 2023: GlobalData
Description: Vietnam's e-commerce market is projected to hit US$17.3 billion in 2023, from US$9.4 billion in 2019, according to a forecast from data and analytics company GlobalData.

Title: Covid-19 sends VN-Index plunging to biggest losing session in 16 years
Description: The VN-Index tumbled 6.28 percent to 835.49 points Monday, its biggest loss since 2004, after 14 new Covid-19 infections were confirmed last weekend.

Title: Rents burden and pressure amid coronavirus epidemic
Description: With businesses reporting dwindling revenues due to the coronavirus epidemic, landlords are cutting their rents by up to 40 percent.

Title: Similac formula (Abbott milk) in Vietnam found curdled and changed color
Description: One mother, Ms N.T.B.L was shocked after feeding her baby over half of Similac Eye -Q3 900gr box from Abbott found milk curdled with unusual smell and changed color. She did immediately complained to the product dealer about the issue.

Title: Samsung News: Seoul plead Vietnam for quarantine exceptions for smartphone engineers
Description: Samsung Electronics Co. has pleaded to the Vietnamese government with the help of the Korean government to exempt its engineers from the universal two-week quarantine on arrivers from South Korea as not to disrupt operation at its biggest smartphone hub.

Title: Coronavirus outbreak to hit Vietnam’s pangasius, shrimp exports in short-term
Description: The spread of the deadly coronavirus is drawing concern from fisheries authorities and seafood exporters in Vietnam.

Title: Shop closures in Hanoi, HCM City due to coronavirus fears
Description: Many shops and restaurants in Hanoi and HCM City have closed or are looking for new owners due to Covid-19 fears.

Title: Savills Vietnam report: FDI still flows into industrial real estate
Description: Investment capital in Vietnam real estate market continues pouring into industrial real estate, according to property consultancy company Savills Vietnam’s report released yesterday.

Title: Covid-19 (Coronavirus): Online shopping prospers
Description: The already booming online shopping platforms are seeing another rush of demand in Vietnam, along with newly introduced telephone order services, as Covid-19 makes consumers wary of public places.

Title: Hanoi to end technology taxis operation effective April 1
Description: Ride-hailing apps such as Grab or Uber will not be allowed to operate cars and decide rates in Hanoi from beginning April.

Title: Personal income tax in Vietnam: Finance Ministry plans to raise
Description: The Ministry of Finance’s (MOF) plan to raise the taxation threshold to VND11 million from VND9 million and raise the family circumstance deduction for independent family members to VND4.4 million from VND3.6 million has been criticized.

Title: Bamboo Airways to open Vietnam-Germany route
Description: Bamboo Airways will launch two direct routes connecting Munich - Germany's third-largest city - with Vietnam's Hanoi and Ho Chi Minh City in the middle of this year.

Title: Covid-19 and Vietnam"s auto industry
Description: Chinese supplies of input materials for the auto industry have been interrupted due to the Covid-19 epidemic, and may run out by the end of the month.

Title: Samsung to lose US$10 billion if South Korean entering Vietnam face quarantine
Description: Samsung may face losses of up to US$10 billion if engineers and experts of the South Korean conglomerate are put into quarantine upon entering Vietnam, VnExpress reported, citing South Korean Ambassador to Vietnam Park Noh-wan.

Title: Rice exports: Cambodia surge
Description: Cambodian rice exports to international markets grew by more than 21 percent in the first two months of this year despite global concerns over the COVID-19 epidemic, according to the country’s Ministry of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries.

Title: President Trump Tariff Threats: Vietnam Buying $3 Billion in U.S. Farm Goods
Description: Vietnam, looking to allay the Trump administration’s wrath over its soaring trade surplus with the U.S., is committing to buy $3 billion in farm products from Nebraska.

Title: Vietnam's farm products observe the change during COVID-19 outbreak
Description: Due to the outbreak of COVID-19, the consumption and purchase of fruit will witness the drastically decrease in the next 2 quarters.

Title: India seeks greater supply chain co-operation with Vietnam
Description: Despite the recent novel coronavirus (COVID-19) epidemic causing a significant impact on various global supply chains, both India and Vietnam are able complement one another, according to a statement made by Indian Ambassador to Vietnam Pranay Verma at a recent press conference held in Hanoi.

Title: Tech giants bring production to Vietnam to avoid COVID-19 implications
Description: With the COVID-19 outbreak disrupting supply chains and vexing producers to no end, a mounting number of businesses are looking to shift operations away from China, with giants Google and Microsoft both opting to bring production to Vietnam.

Title: Urgent measures to implement socio-economic development targets amid COVID-19 outbreak
Description: The Government convenes its monthly session on March 3, under the chair of Prime Minister Nguyen Xuan Phuc, to discuss on urgent measures to implement socio-economic development targets amid the COVID-19 outbreak.

Title: Emirates airline asks staff to take one month unpaid leave amid COVID-19
Description: The Emirates Group is asking staff to take unpaid leave for up to a month at a time due to the rapidly spreading coronavirus.

Title: Giving maximum assistance to production, business amid COVID-19: PM
Description: Prime Minister Nguyen Xuan Phuc required the immediate implementation of credit support packages worth at least 30 trillion VND (nearly 1.3 billion USD) to support enterprises and the people.

Title: Businesses suffer as COVID-19 spreads outside China
Description: The coronavirus epidemic is disrupting supply chains and hampering demand for businesses that source from or sell to countries like Japan and South Korea.

Title: Samsung starts building US$220m R&D centre in Vietnam
Description: Samsung Electronics has started building a US$220 research and development in Vietnam, the South Korean tech giant’s local unit said on Monday (March 2).

Title: Businesses help each other mitigate Covid-19 hardship
Description: Businesses are supporting one another by buying goods from each other to help mitigate the worst effects of the Covid-19 epidemic.

Title: COVID-19 fallout reverberates around Vietnam's wood industry
Description: Vietnam’s wood industry is poised to face a turbulent year ahead as a result of the complicated developments surrounding the novel coronavirus (COVID-19) epidemic in China and other countries globally, said Nguyen Ton Quyen, former Vice President and General Secretary of the Vietnam Timber and Forest Product Association.

Title: Retail, e-commerce biggest marketers in Vietnam
Description: Retail and e-commerce accounted for nearly a quarter of online marketing in Vietnam last year as players compete for more customers.

Title: Vietnam, US enhance farm produce trade
Description: Vietnam has so far granted licences to 460 US producers of meat and meat products and 210 exporters of aquatic products, said Deputy Minister of Agriculture and Rural Development Le Quoc Doanh.

Title: Uniqlo to open its first store in Hanoi in early March
Description: Japanese fashion retailer Uniqlo just announced it would open its first Hanoi store in early March and expects to launch three more by the year-end.

Title: COVID-19 outbreak could cost Vietnam $4 billion in lost tourism in just 3 months
Description: Vietnam's tourism industry is already taking an economic hit due to the coronavirus (COVID-19) outbreak.

Title: Samsung confirms COVID-19 case at phone factory, facility shut
Description: Samsung Electronics said on Saturday that one COVID-19 coronavirus case has been confirmed at its mobile device factory complex in the southeastern city of Gumi, causing a shutdown of its entire facility there until Monday morning.

Title: COVID-19: No ban on flights to RoK, Japan
Description: The Civil Aviation Administration of Vietnam (CAAV) has imposed no ban on flights to the Republic of Korea (RoK) and Japan during the coronavirus disease (COVID-19) outbreak, CAAV Director General Dinh Viet Thang has said.

Title: Border gate reopened for transport of Vietnamese exports to China
Description: A border gate between China and the northern Vietnamese province of Lang Son has been reopened for the transport of exports following a temporary shutdown due to the novel coronavirus disease (COVID-19).

Title: Vietnam car market ranks fourth in Southeast Asia
Description: Vietnam's localization rate for passenger cars of under nine seats is 7 - 10%, much lower than the target of 35 - 45% set for the car industry 20 years ago.

Title: South Korea – Vietnam trade up 6.5% annually since FTA
Description: South Korea's trade with Vietnam has expanded 16.5 percent annually since the two countries implemented a free trade agreement in 2015, data showed Thursday.

Title: Vietnam's Coffee empire Queen abdicates Trung Nguyen throne
Description: Le Hoang Diep Thao has transferred all shares in the Trung Nguyen empire she ran with her ex-husband, pursuant to their final divorce ruling.

Title: Vietnam IT recruiting firm raises million dollars from South Korean investor
Description: IT recruitment firm TopDev has secured a million-dollar investment from South Korea’s leading recruitment company Saramin HR.

Title: A baker debuts dragon fruit bread to help farmers
Description: As metric tons of Vietnam’s dragon fruit are barred from being exported to China in light of the novel coronavirus disease (COVID-19) epidemic, a local baker has debuted new type of bread that uses the fruit as one of its main ingredients to roaring success.

Title: Vietnam needs to find new rice markets to replace China: experts
Description: Since the novel coronavirus (Covid-2019) epidemic will surely affect exports to China, diversifying markets is an urgent requirement for Vietnamese rice exporters, experts have said.

Title: IC&Partners Vietnam: A trusted partner for businesses in facing global integration
Description: With a wide offer of consultancy services and a team of well-known experts specialized in strategy and internationalization consultancy, IC&Partners Vietnam is considered a reliable partner for businesses in the face of difficulties and challenges in the international economic integration process.

Title: Samsung flies phone parts to Vietnam after coronavirus hits supply chain
Description: Samsung has begun flying electronic components for its latest Galaxy phones from China to its factories in Vietnam as it grapples with sweeping supply chain disruptions caused by coronavirus.

Title: Long An province exports 50 tons of dragon fruit a day by sea
Description: The Dragon Fruit Association in Southern Vietnam's Long An province exports 50 tons of dragon fruit a day on average to China and other Southeast Asian nations by sea as export by road has faced lots of difficulties due to the ongoing Covid-19 epidemic, said chairman of the association Nguyen Quoc Trinh.

Title: Vietnam's banks more open for EU investors under newly-approved trade pact
Description: Investors from the EU will have opportunities to own higher stakes in Vietnamese banks than those from other countries under Việt Nam’s commitments in the EU-Việt Nam Free Trade Agreement (EVFTA).

Title: Ten years of efforts to seek for “sweet fruit” EVFTA
Description: The European Parliament (EP) recently voted to officially ratify the European Union-Vietnam Free Trade Agreement (EVFTA) and the EU-Vietnam Investment Protection Agreement (EVIPA). After nearly 10 years of negotiations, the approval of the EVFTA by both Vietnam and the EU has offered a new horizon for greater and more comprehensive cooperation and stronger development, meeting the needs of the people and businesses of the two sides.

Title: EVFTA brings chances and challenges to local agricultural production
Description: The new trade agreement between Vietnam and the European Union opens many doors for agriculture, according to experts.

Title: Border localities asked to resume trade with China
Description: Minister of Industry and Trade Tran Tuan Anh has asked the northern provinces of Lang Son and Quang Ninh to resume imports, exports and transport of goods through three sub-border gates in the two localities after a suspension due to the outbreak of the coronavirus disease (COVID-19).

Title: MARD Minister urges early detection of avian influenza outbreaks
Description: Minister of Agriculture and Rural Development (MARD) Nguyen Xuan Cuong on February 13 urged localities to keep close watch for the early detection and swift settlement of any avian influenza outbreaks.

Title: Kuwait Embassy supports Vietnamese watermelon farmers
Description: The Embassy of Kuwait has purchased two tonnes of watermelon to help farmers in Vietnam’s Bang Giang province as the Vietnam’s agricultural exports are facing difficulties due to the acute respiratory disease caused by the novel coronavirus (COVID-2019).

Title: German investors recognise Vietnam’s efforts in COVID-19 fight
Description: Up to 44 percent of German investors recognise the prompt and effective response by the Vietnamese Government to the new coronavirus (COVID-19) outbreak, according to a survey announced by the German Industry and Commerce in Vietnam (AHK) on February 12.

Title: European Parliament ratifies EU-Vietnam trade pact
Description: The European Parliament on Wednesday ratified an EU free trade accord with Vietnam.

Title: Pork supply expected to recover from this month: MARD
Description: The Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development (MARD) said that the domestic pork supply is forecast to increase from February.

Title: Vietnam’s northern port city will develop more economic zones in 2020
Description: The Vietnam’s northern port city of Hai Phong planned to establish a number of new industrial zones this year, head of the provincial management board of economic zones Phạm Văn Mợi said.

Title: Textiles firms launch emergency production of antibacterial masks
Description: Textiles businesses, including several with no prior experience, have begun producing antibacterial masks after authorities announced a daily need of 10 million.

Title: Qatar's Embassy "rescues" 4 tons of watermelon
Description: The Embassy of the State of Qatar in Hanoi has provided much needed relief for farmers in Vietnam’s central region by purchasing four tonnes of un-consumed watermelon due to the impact of acute respiratory disease caused by the novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV), announced the embassy on Monday (Feb 10).

Title: Vietnam, US jointly study vaccine against African swine fever
Description: The Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development has suggested the US Department of Agriculture (USDA) transfer virus samples to Vietnam to study and produce vaccine against African swine fever (ASF) in the country.

Title: Coronavirus outbreak forces Vietnamese, Chinese border resident exchange reschedule
Description: The exchange between Vietnamese and Chinese border residents, initially scheduled on February 10, is set to take place later this month due to impact of the novel coronavirus (nCoV).

Title: Bamboo Airways starts selling tickets from Prague to Hanoi
Description: Bamboo Airways started selling tickets from Prague, the capital of the Czech Republic, to  Hanoi. The carrier will deploy the Boeing 787-9 twice a week from March 29.

Title: Two growth scenarios amid coronavirus outbreak
Description: Minister and Chairman of the Government Office Mai Tien Dung mentioned two growth scenarios for the country amid the coronavirus (nCoV) outbreak, during a press conference in Hanoi on February 5 following the government’s monthly meeting.

Title: PM orders attention to bird flu fight
Description: Prime Minister Nguyen Xuan Phuc has ordered ministries, agencies and authorities of centrally-run cities and provinces to strengthen measures in the fight against the A/H5N1 flu on poultry and humans, while the acute respiratory disease caused by the novel coronavirus (nCoV) is spreading.

Title: Vietnam’s Pharmacity eyes 1000 stores by end of next year
Description: Vietnam’s largest pharmacy retailer Pharmacity has raised VND730 billion (US$31.8 million) in a fresh funding round as it ramps up its expansion plans.

Title: Bà Rịa-Vũng Tàu targets place among top 3 FDI destinations in Việt Nam
Description: The southern province of Bà Rịa-Vũng Tàu has announced measures that could help achieve its target of becoming one of the three provinces to attract the highest foreign direct investment (FDI) this year.

Title: Forbes’ 30 under 30 list announced
Description: Forbes Việt Nam magazine on Monday announced the 30 under 30 list which featured some of the most influential faces in the field of business and start-ups, social enterprises, arts and creative industries, entertainment, education and science.

Title: Agriculture ministry requests boosting avian flu fight
Description: The Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development (MARD) on February 3 sent an urgent notice to the chairmen of the People’s Committees of centrally-run cities and provinces, calling for drastic and concerted measures against avian flu epidemics.

Title: More companies invest in robot production as demand rises
Description: More Vietnamese businesses are investing in the robot manufacturing industry as demand for such products is growing rapidly in Việt Nam, experts have said.

Title: Vietnam ranks second in number of guest workers in Japan
Description: Vietnam now ranks second in the number of employees working in Japan, according to the latest statistics of Japan's Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare.

Title: Fruit exporters from all over eye Vietnamese market
Description: Vietnam has become quite an ideal market for foreign fruit exporters, due to its developing middle class and high GDP growth.

Title: Finding food that suit your preferences with just several taps
Description: It's not always easy to find the food you want in a new place, which is why apps like GoEat Me are stepping in to bridge the gap between tasty bites and the stomach.

Title: South Korea consolidates as Vietnam’s largest investor in 2019
Description: South Korea consolidated in 2019 as the largest investor in Vietnam by allocating 7.9 billion dollars for new or previous projects, a year to year increase of 7.2 percent.

Title: Vietnamese entrepreneur devises one-stop travel solution for domestic market
Description: As Vietnam’s domestic tourism market continues its upwards trajectory, one local start-up is aiming to solidify the country’s fragmented industry.

Title: Vietnam’s digital economy comes up first in the APAC region
Description: Vietnam is believed to be the fastest-growing digital economy in the Asia Pacific (APAC).

Title: The local pie of retailing is both sweet and bitter
Description: As one of the most dynamic economies in the region, Việt Nam's retail market is attractive for many foreign investors , but it can also be challenging at the same time.

Title: Kakao Mobility launches ride-sharing service in Vietnam
Description: Kakao Mobility has started a rent-a-car-based ride-sharing business in Vietnam. The company chose Vietnam as a test site for the ride-sharing business as the Southeast Asian country has many Korean tourists and no restrictions on the mobility business, while regulations are getting tougher in the Korean market.

Title: EVFTA, EVIPA get green light in European Parliament Committee on International Trade
Description: The European Parliament Committee on International Trade (INTA) on January 21 approved a resolution asking for the European Parliament's ratification of the European Union – Vietnam Free Trade Agreement (EVFTA) and the EU – Vietnam Investment Protection Agreement (IPA).

Title: Vietnam finalises regulations for taxi operators, ride-hailing firms
Description: Vietnam has finally concluded its regulations for taxi and ride-hailing services after 12 times reviewing different proposals.

Title: Computer viruses cause US$902 million damage in Vietnam
Description: Computer viruses caused estimated losses of 20.9 trillion dong (US$902 million) to Vietnamese users last year, much higher than the 14.9 trillion dong reported in 2018, reported Bkav Technology Group.

Title: Delivery services to grow 30-40% in 2020
Description: The logistics sector is forecast to continue growing strongly this year, with expansion in both retail and e-commerce channels.

Title: Vietnam’s textile, wood sectors to gain most from CPTPP
Description: The Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP) and related tariff commitments have opened up multiple opportunities for Vietnam's export industries, with a range of key products including furniture, garments and footwear, according to experts, who feel the wood and textile industries will be the two to benefit the most.

Title: What's in US-China "phase one" trade deal?
Description: The "phase one" agreement includes pledges from China to beef up purchases of American crops and other exports for two years, provides some protections for US technology, and new enforcement mechanisms that allow Washington to quickly impose penalties, which Beijing cannot respond to.

Title: Over 650,000 Vietnamese labourers working abroad
Description: About 650,000 Vietnamese are working in more than 40 countries and territories worldwide, according to statistics of the Department of Overseas Labour under the Ministry of Labour, Invalids and Social Affairs (MoLISA).

Title: Prioritised orientations in ASEAN economic pillar in 2020 unveiled
Description: Three prioritised orientations in the economic pillar of ASEAN in 2020 was revealed during the first meeting of ASEAN Senior Economic Officials in 2020 (SEOM 1/51), which is underway in Hanoi from January 12-14.

Title: Vietnamese people spend US$3.1 billion on imported cars in 2019
Description: The General Department of Customs estimates that in 2019, there were 142,000 cars imported to Vietnam, worth USS 3.1 billion, a rise 71% in volume and 69.4% in value over the same period last year.

Title: Can Tho plans to double capacity of German Development Bank-funded wastewater treatment plant
Description: The Mekong Delta city of Can Tho is planning to double the capacity of its wastewater collection and treatment plant, which was partly funded by the German Development Bank (KfW), and considers this one of the investment priorities in the coming time.

Title: Vietnam exports likely to keep overperforming: Report
Description: VIETNAM’s exports should out-perform the rest of South-east Asia in 2020, Maybank Kim Eng economists expect, even as the downturn in regional shipments is likely to bottom out.

Title: Vietnamese enterprises go abroad
Description: Not only expanding the export market, in recent years, several enterprises have also boldly increased building modern factories in foreign countries or acquired foreign enterprises right in the host countries. With such aforesaid strategy, several enterprises have step by step fortified their positions as well as the market share of Vietnamese products in global market.

Title: US-China "phase one" trade deal to be signed on Jan 15: Trump
Description: A partial new US-China trade agreement will be signed in the middle of next month, US President Donald Trump said on Tuesday (Dec 31), announcing that he will also then travel to China for continued talks.
